page.title: 19Horses in Holmes.
page.content: There are two types of horses in the area Shires and Riding Horses. The shires were used to work before tractors were invented. They maybe pulled carts, canal barges or ploughs. Now the shire horses are all on one farm and are the Clydesdale Breed. The horses are famous for winning prizes at many shows and are mostly exported to Canada and America. At the next farm Becconsall Stables they stable about 35 horses. Some belong to the stables and some belong to riders who stable them there. There is a big indoor riding school. Horses are "broken in" and trained. They hold shows and jumping competitions. Children and adults can have riding lessons. There are many fields round the stables where the horses are grazed and ridden. The stables are kept busy.
